intro: Lasius, commonly known as the ant genus, is a group of ground-nesting ants found primarily in temperate regions. These ants are characterized by their small size, typically ranging from 2 to 6 millimeters in length, and their ability to form large colonies. They play a significant role in soil aeration and nutrient cycling through their foraging and nest-building activities.
